org.jvnet.inflector

Class RuleBasedPluralizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jvnet.inflector.RuleBasedPluralizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pluralizer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    NounPluralizer, NounPluralizer

    public class RuleBasedPluralizer
extends Object
implements Pluralizer

    An implementation of Pluralizer that is implemented using an ordered list of Rules. It is possible to specify a fallback Pluralizer that is invoked if none of the rules match. This makes it easy to override some rules of another Pluralizer.

    This class also preserves leading and trailing whitespace, so individual rules don't need to explicitly handle it. Case is also preserved; that is, the output of all uppercase input is automatically uppercased, and the output of titlecase input is automatically titlecased. This means rules can act in a case-insensitive manner.

    Instances of this class are safe for multiple concurrent threads.

    Author:
    Tom White

    • Constructor Detail

      • RuleBasedPluralizer

        public RuleBasedPluralizer()

        Constructs a pluralizer with an empty list of rules. Use the setters to configure.

      • RuleBasedPluralizer

        public RuleBasedPluralizer(List<Rule> rules,
                   Locale locale)

        Constructs a pluralizer that uses a list of rules then an identity Pluralizer if none of the rules match. This is useful to build your own Pluralizer from scratch.

        Parameters:
        rules - the rules to apply in order
        locale - the locale specifying the language of the pluralizer

      • RuleBasedPluralizer

        public RuleBasedPluralizer(List<Rule> rules,
                   Locale locale,
                   Pluralizer fallbackPluralizer)

        Constructs a pluralizer that uses first a list of rules then a fallback Pluralizer. This is useful to override the behaviour of an existing Pluralizer.

        Parameters:
        rules - the rules to apply in order
        locale - the locale specifying the language of the pluralizer
        fallbackPluralizer - the pluralizer to use if no rules match

      • pluralize

        public String pluralize(String word)

        Converts a noun or pronoun to its plural form.

        This method is equivalent to calling pluralize(word, 2).

        The return value is not defined if this method is passed a plural form.

        Specified by:
        pluralize in interface Pluralizer
        Parameters:
        word - a singular noun
        Returns:
        the plural form of the noun

      • pluralize

        public String pluralize(String word,
               int number)

        Converts a noun or pronoun to its plural form for the given number of instances. If number is 1, word is returned unchanged.

        The return value is not defined if this method is passed a plural form.

        Specified by:
        pluralize in interface Pluralizer
        Parameters:
        word - a singular noun
        number - the number of objects being referred to in the plural
        Returns:
        the plural form of the noun

      • pluralizeInternal

        protected String pluralizeInternal(String word)

        Goes through the rules in turn until a match is found at which point the rule is applied and the result returned. If no rule matches, returns null.

        Parameters:
        word - a singular noun
        Returns:
        the plural form of the noun, or null if no rule matches

      • postProcess

        protected String postProcess(String trimmedWord,
                 String pluralizedWord)

        Apply processing to pluralizedWord. This implementation ensures the case of the plural is consistent with the case of the input word.

        If trimmedWord is all uppercase, then pluralizedWord is uppercased. If trimmedWord is titlecase, then pluralizedWord is titlecased.

        Parameters:
        trimmedWord - the input word, with leading and trailing whitespace removed
        pluralizedWord - the pluralized word
        Returns:
        the pluralizedWord after processing
